page.content:
{ EDUCATION IN LEIGH AND BRANSFORD (1)
A{dame school}was endowed in 1778 and was housed in a cottage on the Suckley Road. The schoolmaster lived in a room partitioned from the school- room and was paid an annual salary of Â£15.14s. for teaching the 'three R's' and church catechism. The school existed until 1861, when a{National {School}was built on the site of the present school. It was a brick and timber building which was extended in 1891, when there were 126 children of all ages on roll. Children then paid two pence per week and one penny was returned if they had full attendance. By 1900 the average roll was 90, in the charge of a master and mistress. The school was demolished in 1932 and replaced by a 'temporary' wooden structure - still in existence!
